CMB_Enrage.speaker: Owlbear
CMB_Enrage.context: CinematicNodeContext: Charges to attack.NodeContext: Horrified and enraged

PAD_HealedOwlbear.speaker: Player
PAD_HealedOwlbear.text: Healed - but she doesn't look much happier.
PAD_HealedOwlbear.context: NodeContext: Karlach: 'I healed you, owlbear--> you still look like you're gonna rip my face off.'

AD_Mocking.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Mocking.context: NodeContext: Jeering/mocking, and a bit sing-song

AD_Leaving.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Leaving.text: Wha', fun's over? All right then...

Goblin_01.speaker: Tracker Slice
Goblin_01.text: Just scraping up some pieces, majesty. Don't mind me.

AD_Boss.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_Boss.text: Gotta be somethin' in this heap.
AD_Boss.context: NodeContext: with disdain. isn't there anything interesting inthis shithole?

AD_GoblinsLooting.speaker: Tracker Slice
AD_GoblinsLooting.context: NodeContext: looking for results from subordinates she perceives as being idiots

EmptyMindflayerPod.speaker: Narrator
EmptyMindflayerPod.text: *An empty mind flayer vessel. If its occupant survived, they're nowhere to be seen.*

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: They spoke of the Absolute - same as that goblin, Sazza. Curious.

PAD_PostScene.speaker: Player
PAD_PostScene.text: Seems as though the Absolute's attracting followers from all kinds of places.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: Weapon blueprints. A master blacksmith's work.

PAD.speaker: Player
PAD.text: The inking is rough - a work in progress, surely.

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Goblin Warrior
CheckpointGuards.text: 'Allo and welcome to Bogrot! Now, kindly - giz all your stuff.
CheckpointGuards.context: NodeContext: A goblin's closest approximation of courtesty, faintly mocking. He's loudly welcoming you to the town he has dubbed 'Bogrot'

CheckpointGuards.speaker: Narrator
CheckpointGuards.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

CheckpointGuardsWarning.speaker: Goblin Sharp-Eye
CheckpointGuardsWarning.context: NodeContext: We caught him idling at the entrance of a checkpoint. Not trying very hard with the lie.

003_Dead.speaker: Player
003_Dead.text: Is there anything valuable around here?

AD_FoundJournal.speaker: Player
AD_FoundJournal.text: Someone's diary. Might explain what happened here.

AD_DoorMarks.speaker: Narrator
AD_DoorMarks.text: *Names and heights have been carved into the wood over the years. The last two read 'Maggie Terrens' and 'Marcus Terrens'. Twins, perhaps.*

AD_Crack.speaker: c1a1d9d2-d3b5-49fc-ad48-9312552c7caa
AD_Crack.context: InternalNodeContext: SFX only - wood creaking and snapping under strain.NodeContext: SFX only - do not record

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're a True Soul. You can't die. Please stay with us.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The true soul is dying, laying on the ground, injured.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: I don't think he's conscious. Can you hear us, Ed?
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Brynna turns toward the player.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You! Not a step closer.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *A strange symbol glows, marked on their flesh, and something within you stirs in response.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: What happened to your friend?

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: An owlbear. Please, do you have any -

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Shut up, Andrick! Do you serve the Absolute?

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: Wait.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *The injured man locks eyes with you. A familiar squirming churns in your head.*

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Move away, reaching for your weapon.

Cultists.speaker: Narrator
Cultists.text: *Your limbs do not obey. Your minds intertwine. You see his siblings - Andrick and Brynna. New recruits. Yours to shepherd.*

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: Protect them.

Cultists.speaker: Edowin
Cultists.text: They are a True Soul. Mind them. They will - they - they...
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: *Huddock smiled before falling still with a final, bloody wheeze of air.*NodeContext: Validated - he thought he sensed a likeminded individual, and was proven correct. Right on the verge of losing consciousness from his injuries. he dies after saying this.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: Edowin. Ed! Please!
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.NodeContext: Andrick drops his weapon and kneels beside Edowin.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: He's with the Absolute now.
Cultists.context: CinematicNodeContext: The cultists pause for an extra moment here before continuing the dialogue, to properly acknowledge the true soul's passing.NodeContext: Sad, mourning air

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: You're... you're a True Soul. Edowin, our brother - he was chosen. Like you.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Still sad from brother dying. Trying to be strong.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: Do you have orders for us? We were reporting to Edowin.
Cultists.context: NodeContext: Hopeful for guidance, sad remembering her brother. We WERE reporting to Edowin, but... he just died.

Cultists.speaker: Player
Cultists.text: Why are you out here? The wilderness is dangerous.

Cultists.speaker: Brynna
Cultists.text: We know that all too well. But... the Absolute sent us here.

Cultists.speaker: Andrick
Cultists.text: We're looking for fugitives. Survivors from that ship that crashed farther west of here.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: It... it got her. It got Bry too.
Cultist001_InCave.context: NodeContext: Mourning his sister, who was also killed by the owlbear.

Cultist001_InCave.speaker: Andrick
Cultist001_InCave.text: What... what do I do now?

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Never thought I'd ever walk in on a bugbear and an ogre.

PAD_AfterFight.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterFight.text: Everytime I close my eyes, I can see... it.

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *The well stands, as it has for ages.*

InteractWithWell.speaker: Narrator
InteractWithWell.text: *Apart from an overgrowth of moss, the well looks unremarkable.*

AD_EttercapDisturbanceWarning.context: NodeContext: A bit like a spider chirp, but a bit louder, if possible.

Dead.speaker: Fezzerk
Dead.context: NodeContext: A cryptic, fragmented croak, spoken by a temporarily-resurrected corpse.

AD.speaker: Chock
AD.text: Dwarf better. Dwarf sweet like honey.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Must you? This inane chatter pains me.

AD.speaker: Lump the Enlightened
AD.text: Oh, for... shut mouth! Head hurt!
AD.context: NodeContext: He is exasperated. Then he speaks in typical ogre speak.

SpeedUp.speaker: Narrator
SpeedUp.context: NodeContext: Intentionally blank for cinematic purposes
CinematicNodeContext: Unfortunate Gnome gets flung off.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.text: Come on! What are you waiting for?!
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: The gnome grows exasperated and panicky over the player's delay in cutting him free.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: CinematicNodeContext: The gnome is tied to the (stationary) sail of a wind, begging to be cut free by the player. He's close to the ground and within normal speaking range.NodeContext: Urgent, panicked. The gnome begs to be untied from the sail of a windmill. The sail is at the lowermost part of its rotation in relation to the ground, and the gnome is within normal speaking range.

TiedUp.speaker: Player
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Incredulous. His good samaritan seems to be haggling for a reward before even freeing him.

TiedUp.speaker: Barcus Wroot
TiedUp.context: NodeContext: Impatient. He's used to being extorted.

PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.speaker: Player
PAD_PickupPrayerSheet.text: A prayer sheet. What's this symbol on it?

PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.speaker: Player
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.text: Chest's unlocked. My prayers are answered.
PAD_OpenStashWithPrayer.context: NodeContext: Reacting to a prayer unlocking a magically sealed chest.

PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.speaker: Player
PAD_PlayerTriedToTakeTome.text: Sorry, but that book is spoken for - by me.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: I've got the plans and the sussur bark. Now I need somewhere to craft it all.

VB_TakeSussurSap.speaker: Player
VB_TakeSussurSap.text: The forge at the blacksmith's house should do.

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *A candy-sweet scent wafts forth: the sussur bark infuses the weapon from within the flames.*

ForgeWeapon.speaker: Narrator
ForgeWeapon.text: *The flames sputter away. The sword is complete.*

VB_TakePlans.speaker: Player
VB_TakePlans.text: Weapon blueprints. They call for sussur bark...

VB_TakeJournal.speaker: Player
VB_TakeJournal.text: Interesting. I wonder if those blueprints survived.

PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.speaker: Player
PAD_NatureCheckOutcome.text: If only I knew where to find some.

VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.speaker: Player
VB_PhaseSpiderDisappear.text: What in the hells was that?

VB_FindWeakWall.speaker: Player
VB_FindWeakWall.text: A wonder this shoddy wall hasn't already collapsed.

PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.speaker: Player
PAD_ForgeAndBarkCombined.text: The bark is in place. Now, for a greatsword, dagger, or sickle.

AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.speaker: Goblin Tracker
AD_Combat_Goblins_Ranger_01.text: You'll look good with a few arrows sticking out of your gut!

ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.speaker: Narrator
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.text: *This fight could have been avoided, but now you've made it inevitable.*
ApproachedUnfortunateGnome.context: NodeContext: Hostile. A pre-combat utterance potentially spoken by any goblin or worg at the windmill

AD_MissingPoster.speaker: Narrator
AD_MissingPoster.text: *Missing children: Maggie Terrens, Marcus Terrens, Mathen Deetch, Rochelle Kirk*

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: Lapis root? Saffa? Rare to see these so far north.

VB_InspectHerbs.speaker: Player
VB_InspectHerbs.text: A shame they've wilted, these must have cost a fortune.

VB_InspectCookingPot.speaker: Player
VB_InspectCookingPot.text: Reeks of mugwort. Tastes terrible, but makes some useful potions.

VB_ReadLedger.speaker: Player
VB_ReadLedger.text: It says there's a cellar here somewhere.

VB_Trap.speaker: Player
VB_Trap.context: NodeContext: A relieved observation. An automated booby trap that had been causing strife just ran out of fuel.

VB_Mirror.speaker: Player
VB_Mirror.context: NodeContext: Pondering, investigative. They just detected something strange that they can't put their finger on.
